name: Rio Sands Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked in to the Rio Sands on a Friday and Saturday night in August so we got stung with their highest tariff - in fact this hotel or should I say motel was the most expensive during our 9 week trip to the US and Canada - even more expensive than a 4 star in San Francisco!
reviews.title: Very over priced and shabby decor ...

reviews.text: The photos on the hotel website must have been taken years ago as the outer appearance is very shabby, the sort of shabby that makes your heart drop as you approach ...
reviews.title: A good place for families

likes.disliked: — Ant spray smell in room; thin bedspreads; uncomfrotable mattress on sofa bed

reviews.text: Still we were willing to give it the benefit of the doubt, inner beauty etc, however we were sorely disappointed. Our room, with sea view, was in the 'new' building and claiming a sea view is a stretch, we overlooked the road and if you stood at the edge of the balcony you could see the sea - just.
reviews.title: OK for budget

likes.disliked: — Don't go barefoot around your room. Bring your own blankets.

reviews.text: The room was was very old and dated with no aircon. The saving grace for this place was the bed - a comfy king - and the pool which is pretty big for a motel.
reviews.title: A family favorite!

likes.disliked: — building is ugly, but rooms are clean, and the garden/lawn area is nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not recommend this hotel unless you are really struggling to find accommodation - do not pay anywhere near 3 figures it is not worth it, this is a basic motel.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: We loved Aptos and could not believe the amazing deal we got at this hotel.
reviews.title: Great value
We go every year. Family loves the pool, breakfast, beach!
reviews.text: We had a room without bars on the windows - it was in the Annex - had a deck and a kitchen. Very roomy, great price and only 3 blocks from a beautiful beach!!

reviews.title: Not worth the risk, just to save a few bucks.
reviews.text: We went to wineries in the area on the way there, stayed for one night, walked to dinner at Sanderlings - took a very long time for a table, but view and food were great - we just waited in the bar and had drinks and an appetizer. After dinner, we took a stroll on the beach - it was awesome!! Then walked back to our hotel. Felt very safe to me there.

reviews.title: Bad Choice
reviews.text: We went in October so the weather was great - did not notice there was no A/C.

reviews.title: Two block walk to a wonderful beach
reviews.text: Another of our great, romantic getaways when we lived in CA - prbably one of our favorites!!

description: Rio Sands Hotel is by the beach. Just a 2 minute walk to 20 miles of walkable sea shore. We have rooms with fully stocked kitchenettes, a BBQ area, pool heated to 80 degrees year round. Enjoy our continental breakfast served daily.
